name: Jing Deng 0001
content: Prof. Jing Deng at UNC Greensboro Welcome to Prof. Jing Deng's Homepage Home | Teaching | Research | Publications | CV | Misc Jing Deng, Ph.D., IEEE Fellow Associate Dean, College of Arts and Sciences Bank of America Distinguished Professor, Computer Science UNC Greensboro, 105 Foust Building 1400 Spring Garden St. Greensboro, NC 27412-6170 Email: jing.deng@ieee.org jing.deng@uncg.edu Office: 105 Foust Building Virtual Office on Microsoft Teams Phone: (336) 334-3974 Education: Ph.D., Cornell University (Electrical and Computer Engineering), 2002 M.E., Tsinghua University (Electronic Engineering), Beijing, P. R. China, 1997 B.E., Tsinghua University (Electronic Engineering), Beijing, P. R. China, 1994 Short Bio: Dr. Jing Deng is an Associate Dean in the College of Arts and Sciences and the Bank of America Distinguished Professor in the Department of Computer Science (CS) at UNC Greensboro (UNCG). He served as the Head of Computer Science between 2019 and 2024. Dr. Deng visited the Department of Electrical Engineering at Princeton University and the Department of Electrical and Computer Engineering, WINLAB at Rutgers University in Fall of 2005. He was with the Department of Computer Science at the University of New Orleans from 2004 to 2008. He served as a Research Assistant Professor in the Department of Electrical Engineering & Computer Science at Syracuse University from 2002 to 2004. He received his Ph.D. degree from School of Electrical and Computer Engineering at Cornell University, Ithaca, NY in January, 2002. Dr. Deng is a Fellow of the IEEE. In 2015, Dr. Deng's joint paper (with Dr. Fu and Mr. Yang) on social network received the best paper award in IARIA's Third International Conference on Building and Exploring Web Based Environments (WEB'15). In 2013, Dr. Deng received the prestigious Test-of-Time Award presented by the ACM Special Interest Group on Security, Audit and Control (SIGSAC) for his joint publication with Drs. Du, Han, and Varshney in the area of key predistribution in wireless sensor networks, published in CCS 2003. Dr. Deng is an associate editor for IEEE Open Journal of the Computer Society. He served as an associate editor of IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing (TMC) (2018-2023) and IEEE Transactions on Vehicular Technology (TVT) (2008-2018). Dr. Deng's research focuses include online social networks, wireless networks, and network security. Graduate Assistant Position: Ph.D. applicants are welcome to contact me for their interests in my research. Our Graduate Research Assistant (GRA/GA/RA) positions provide full financial support, which include monthly stipend and full tuition remissions. Recent Publications: N. Pokala, S. Hossan, J.
